references.paper_title: Membership inference attacks against machine learning models
references.reason: This paper is foundational for membership inference attacks (MIAs), a core concept in the paper's attack methodology.

references.paper_title: Retrieval-augmented generation for knowledge-intensive NLP tasks
references.reason: This paper introduces Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), the central technology the paper analyzes for vulnerabilities.

references.paper_title: Membership inference attacks from first principles
references.reason: This work provides a theoretical foundation for MIAs, informing the design and understanding of stealthy attacks.

references.paper_title: Is My Data in Your Retrieval Database? Membership Inference Attacks Against Retrieval Augmented Generation
references.reason: This is a directly related work on MIAs against RAG systems, providing a baseline and comparison point for the new attack.

references.paper_title: Generating Is Believing: Membership Inference Attacks against Retrieval-Augmented Generation
references.reason: This is another directly related work focusing on MIAs against RAG, further establishing the context and importance of the research area.
